review_blob: Very high hop acidic taste. Hard to pull through the whole thing. Distinct Yuengling taste is there in the finish but overwhelmed by the metallic hop taste.
Watered down Yuengling. Less hops and a more watery flavor. Stick with the original.
Big thick quad with a small hint of plumb and pitted fruit with a Belgian candy finish.
Decent weizen. Nice and cloudy with a nice head. Puckering palate but a fruity finish.
Meh, pretty boring belles that is thin and orange. Decent hopping but overall just too weak.
Big nose of citrus hops. Almost a citra bomb but has a little bit of high hops to finish off the bitterness.
Had a sic pack stick around in my fridge for a long time. Stupid branding and terribly weak and unenjoyable. First bad offering from Smutty.
Low alcohol Belgian which is a throw off for me. Simple enough and true to style but nothing redeeming.
Nice solid pale ale. A tiny bit on the thick side otherwise a well balanced beer.
beer_name: Greenbrier Valley Wild Trail Pale Ale

review_blob: Love this black IPA for the branding and the toasty chocolate taste with a nice hop follow and warm booze.
Nice big reddish Rye IPA. Thick off white head and a dark pour. Nice aroma of citrus and pine with a palate of boozy malt.
beer_name: Bridge Brew Works Momma Rye IPA

review_blob: Solid session IPA that has a nice hop palate and easy finish. Surprisingly good beer as I usually don't like the style.
Great beer. Now this is what a session beer should be. Great flavor but not overwhelming with the hops. Piney and sticky, truly good.
Part of the chalkboard series. Nice big and bold offering from these guys. Their beers are a little thicker and this one follows through but is just a bit too syrupy.
Loved this as i love me some galaxy hops! The flavor really comes through as there is not a ton of alcohol comparatively. Yay.
Not one of the only craft beer cans anymore! This is still a very good esb in a can. No off tastes and just a clean red/esb.
Drank in July. Decent IPA that had good hop flavor and was fairly smooth. A little fruity on the nose and palate which was refreshing.
Drank in July. Had a good golden ale taste to it that was fairly smooth and a decent floral hop aroma.
Wow, i actually enjoyed this ice beer because i was on a boat drinking 4% beers for a week and this at least tasted like alcohol...not really like beer though.
Another nice big and warm red IPA that hits the black diamond. Good alcohol and a little bit of earthy aroma and follow through.
beer_name: Boulder Beer Slope Style Winter IPA

review_blob: Very appropriate for my river trip to utah. Nice big red ipa with a great malt base and deep hop flavor.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada River Ryed Rye IPA

review_blob: A touch of smoke and roast but an otherwise watered down version of a porter.
beer_name: Vernal Brewing Company: Directional Smoked Porter

review_blob: Good red that was spot on in a copper reddish hue with nice off white head. Good almost esb red taste. Best offering of the brewery i had.
Light and uninspired. The peach flavor is just a hint that isnt as strong as claimed. Not a bad thing, but just an ok beer.
Good pils that keeps true to a German style but is a little watery on the finish.
Very nice pale ale for a can. No off mettalic taste or odd flavors, just an easy drinking appropriately hoppy PA.
Figured out toward the end of my trip to drink can/bottled beer in Utah. Nice IPA that actually tasted like beer and had a good hop matrix to it. These guys can make some beer.
Pretty standard amber that doesnt do too much to differentiate itself from other easy drinking ambers. That being said it is not bad.
Very good doppel. It was nice to have a higher alcohol beer after soo many 4% so that may have influenced the rating.
Probably the best and most flavorful beer I had on my trip to Utah. Very fresh and enjoyable.
Nice Pils that had a pleasant high hop taste with fresh malt and a warm finish despite the low alcohol.
Decent pale ale that is a little flat and casky. Decent cloudy pour with a good froath and hop palate finish that is smooth. Almost esb like.
A little more flavor than the pils. Decent bready and bannana notes and a hazy off yellow color.
Pretty bland pilsener with a very light head and faint straw aroma. Not much on the hops or high hits. Basic.
Decently hazy weizen with a banana citrus finish that leaves a little to be desired.
Decently hazy weizen with a banana citrus finish that leaves a little to be desired.
Really nice beer with lots of rye and molasses. Not too thick though with a nice head and breads aroma.
Not a big fan of the corriander taste but a decently balanced triple without it.
I like a nice bold smoke beer and this hit well. Nice balance from the bourbon aging as well. Yummy.
A little hoppy and thin for a helles. Light and session-able which is a big plus for this usually thick style.
beer_name: Southern Tier Where The Helles Summer?

review_blob: Cant really put my finger on this one. Not as much chocolate as for a double but its there. Not as silky as it says and is a little over carbonated for a bock.
Didnt catch the banana or peanut butter but did get a little bit of roast and some salty caramel. Decent.
Nice medium body porter with a small hint of cocoa nibs and a touch of roast.
Really nice IPA that is citrus and pine but simple and smooth. Not much of a bomb but just a nice drinker.
Pretty standard Amber ale that had a soft palate and not much else in the way of flavor.
Pine and citrus IPA with a nice balanced hop palate and alcohol. Enjoyable first offering.
beer_name: RAR Nanticoke Nectar India Pale Ale

review_blob: Great black IPA with a pine aroma and resin that persists throughout the experience.
Salty and smooth with a bit of rast and a dry finish. Really nice oyster stout.
beer_name: Flying Dog Pearl Necklace Oyster Stout

review_blob: Sweet grain aroma. Nice alcohol warmth with a slight bready and bannana taste.
Big froathy pour that has smells of smoke and earth. Good hop taste with a deep dark malt and nice alcohol warmth.
